channel.title: Astral Projection
channel.description:
Astral Projection is the ability to leave your physical body, and travel to the Astral Plane. Now many people get Astral and Etheric (I think it's spelled right) projection mixed up. [b]Astral Projection[/b] is leaving the physical plane entirely. [b]Etheric Projection[/b] is leaving your body; but staying in the physical plane. Now, I'll be honest; I've only barely done it twice, and I'm still a beginner at it. But, I am interested to see if anyone here believes in it, and if they could share their methods.
My method is pretty simple; listen to some binaural beats and lie down, relax, concentrate on the back of my head, and wait for the vibrations.
So do you believe?
EDIT: Please give reasoning, or back up your belief. Thank you.

item.title: Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @maniown maniown
item.description:
@maniown wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:64, topic:280885”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=370953.msg2808284#msg2808284 date=1243848189]
you know those times when you arent quite asleep and not quite awake either and your sort of dreaming? well i had one of those the other day and there was something on my foot and i kicked my foot to get rid of it and my actual foot moved and it smashed into the wall but it was really wierd it felt like there actually was something on my foot and i had to get it off and then i sort of woke up as i had pain running up my whole leg
[/quote]
This happens to me, ill almost be asleep, kinda dozing and then ill trip or fall off a skateboard and ill jerk and wake up a little more and doze off again[/quote]

Sounds like you had some bad acid m8. Lol

Read full topic

item.title: Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @wayzey wayzey
item.description:
@wayzey wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:62, topic:280885”][quote author=wayzey link=topic=370953.msg2811324#msg2811324 date=1244009888]

hmm, that will be harder to come up with an experiment for

Etheric Projection would be easier to experiment. You’re still not really asleep, but you remain in your physical environment.

Anyways. I believe in out-of-body-experiences. However astral projection is more of a belief-centered one. I don’t believe in any of the paranormal stuff that goes along with it. It’s dumb psychics who believe in that crap.

Yup, I thought you were one of those “dumb psychics” up until you said this xD I mistook you for one of them cause you were going on about leaving your body and how Astral Projection is real. I still think you’re one of those “Dumb Psychics” but not one who takes their beliefs to extremes and bases their life around them. I guess you’d be more of just a person who has wierd beliefs than a “Dumb Psychic”
[/quote]

I don’t have any belief that doesn’t fit into science. When I say leave your body I never meant to physically leave as a soul or something. I understand that if I was to leave my body, it would only be in my mind.

Despite how the wikipedia article makes it seem, you don’t need to believe in any of the paranormal stories that go along with astral projection. I’m sure most practicers don’t believe in it either and are able to distinguish that it’s only in their mind. And really the whole idea of astral projection is to “look into” your self and your mind.[/quote]

Look if it’s not supernatural flubajube then you’re thinking of the wrong thing. Astral Projection is different from what you’re thinking of.

Read full topic

I guess you’d be more of just a person who has wierd beliefs than a “Dumb Psychic”[/quote]

I don’t have any belief that doesn’t fit into science. When I say leave your body I never meant to physically leave as a soul or something. I understand that if I was to leave my body, it would only be in my mind.

Despite how the wikipedia article makes it seem, you don’t need to believe in any of the paranormal stories that go along with astral projection. I’m sure most practicers don’t believe in it either and are able to distinguish that it’s only in their mind. And really the whole idea of astral projection is to “look into” your self and your mind.

item.title: Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @wayzey wayzey
item.description:
@wayzey wrote:

yakman:

hmm, that will be harder to come up with an experiment for

Not harder. Impossible.
It’s to do with the supernatural and thus comes under the classification of a belief. There is no way to prove it so we just assume it isn’t true.

If you did your experiment we could establish if Astral Projection is even possible. It still wouldn’t be real or testable but we would be able to establish whether or not it’s even possible for those people to do this Astral Projection thing.
If person knows what picture is then that still doesn’t prove Astral projection is real cause you don’t know what happened in the dream, there are infinate explainations all equally true. If person doesn’t know what picture was or can’t describe it then that person is 100% bullshitting.

Read full topic

hmm, that will be harder to come up with an experiment for

item.title: Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Yeah you’re not supposed to sleep. You meditate into a trance where your brain works at the same frequency as sleep. But you are still aware. And with astral projection, you’re not just in the same environment. You’re in some other reality pretty much.

Read full topic

item.title: Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:55, topic:280885”]heres an experiment we could do.

  1. subject goes to sleep planning to have Astral projection.

  2. assistants hook him up to an EEG machine to monitor his state and prove that he was asleep the whole time. They also place a colourful recognisable picture on his stomach or chest, and wait a few hours,

  3. assistants remove the picture and hide it.

  4. subject has Astral projection, he should be able to see his body from above with the picture on top and should be able to describe it to the assistants, dispite having never seen it before.

obviously that method would need some tweaking, perhaps you’d do it with many different subjects on many occasions to rule out the possibility of guesswork.

another way you could do it is to have the subject sleep on the bottom bunk of a bunkbed, and put the picture on the top bunk.

if you do this experiment and write it up so that it passes peer-review, i will believe that Astral-projection-like-experiences exist.[/quote]
i thought astral projection was outside of sleep?
otherwise thats just dreaming
anyways, im pretty sure you arent supposed to be able to see new things, its just a dream like thing where you see yourself

Read full topic

item.title: Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

heres an experiment we could do.

  1. subject goes to sleep planning to have Astral projection.

  2. assistants hook him up to an EEG machine to monitor his state and prove that he was asleep the whole time. They also place a colourful recognisable picture on his stomach or chest, and wait a few hours,

  3. assistants remove the picture and hide it.

  4. subject has Astral projection, he should be able to see his body from above with the picture on top and should be able to describe it to the assistants, dispite having never seen it before.

obviously that method would need some tweaking, perhaps you’d do it with many different subjects on many occasions to rule out the possibility of guesswork.

another way you could do it is to have the subject sleep on the bottom bunk of a bunkbed, and put the picture on the top bunk.

if you do this experiment and write it up so that it passes peer-review, i will believe that Astral-projection-like-experiences exist.

Read full topic

item.title: Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @wayzey wayzey
item.description:
@wayzey wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:52, topic:280885”][quote author=wayzey link=topic=370953.msg2808367#msg2808367 date=1243855558]
I barely dream now and I haven’t had a nightmare since I was about 12. Maybe it’s to do with the fact that i’m skeptical about everything or maybe it’s just cause I used to have sleeping problems, I duno.
[/quote]

Everyone, including you, dreams about 5 times a night. Just because you can’t remember it, doesn’t mean you don’t dream.

you know those times when you arent quite asleep and not quite awake either and your sort of dreaming? well i had one of those the other day and there was something on my foot and i kicked my foot to get rid of it and my actual foot moved and it smashed into the wall but it was really wierd it felt like there actually was something on my foot and i had to get it off and then i sort of woke up as i had pain running up my whole leg

Something similar, which has the same cause, is dreaming of you falling down and than actually ‘landing’ on your bed. What happens here is the following: for some reason your muscle’s contract, and because it feels like you are falling you ‘dream’ that you fall.

Wayzey: I agree that astral projection isn’t something supernatural. But it is real, as real as lucid dreaming is. It actually is a form of lucid dreaming.[/quote]

Yer I know that you dream 4 times a night. I actually thought you dreamt the entire time you sleep but aye doesn’t matter.
I meant that I don’t see dreams now like you know how you occasionally can remember a dream you had or when you feel like your in the dream and it feels 100% real but as soon as you get out of it you realise it wasn’t. I barely get that now, Like once or twice a year.

Astral projection is not real. Your concept of Astral projection is wrong. It’s not when you dream as if you are floating outside your body, that’s simply dreaming. Astral projection is about physically going outside your body and into one or more Astral planes. Now that definition is to do with supernatural.

To make what i’ve said above a hypothesis and not a belief you need to:

  1. Prove you can physically leave your body
  2. Prove that these Astral planes exist

And you you have to have like solid evidence for this, it cannot be something that COULD prove it is possible to leave your body, it has to be something that is obvious and pretty much staring Science in the face.

Read full topic

had one of those but i was just walking along the road and my i tripped and my whole leg seized and then the rest of my as it felt like i hit the ground

item.title: Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

wayzey:

I barely dream now and I haven’t had a nightmare since I was about 12. Maybe it’s to do with the fact that i’m skeptical about everything or maybe it’s just cause I used to have sleeping problems, I duno.

Everyone, including you, dreams about 5 times a night. Just because you can’t remember it, doesn’t mean you don’t dream.

sanga282:

you know those times when you arent quite asleep and not quite awake either and your sort of dreaming? well i had one of those the other day and there was something on my foot and i kicked my foot to get rid of it and my actual foot moved and it smashed into the wall but it was really wierd it felt like there actually was something on my foot and i had to get it off and then i sort of woke up as i had pain running up my whole leg

Something similar, which has the same cause, is dreaming of you falling down and than actually ‘landing’ on your bed. What happens here is the following: for some reason your muscle’s contract, and because it feels like you are falling you ‘dream’ that you fall.

Wayzey: I agree that astral projection isn’t something supernatural. But it is real, as real as lucid dreaming is. It actually is a form of lucid dreaming.

Read full topic

item.title: Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“wayzey, post:50, topic:280885”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=370953.msg2808284#msg2808284 date=1243848189]
you know those times when you arent quite asleep and not quite awake either and your sort of dreaming? well i had one of those the other day and there was something on my foot and i kicked my foot to get rid of it and my actual foot moved and it smashed into the wall but it was really wierd it felt like there actually was something on my foot and i had to get it off and then i sort of woke up as i had pain running up my whole leg
[/quote]

That’s called a dream…
If you’re talking about that, that has nothing to do with the supernatural, it’s like when you wake up from a nightmare your body is exhausted and you’re puffing and panting. It’s because the nightmare seems real to you so your body reacts to it like it would in reality.

I barely dream now and I haven’t had a nightmare since I was about 12. Maybe it’s to do with the fact that i’m skeptical about everything or maybe it’s just cause I used to have sleeping problems, I duno.

I used to have this, usually when i’m waking up in the morning but there’s nothing to it, it’s simply dreaming. Believing that it actually happened is retarded. It’s most likely your foot smashed against the wall in your dream because your leg pained not the other way round. If it was the other way round then it’s because of what i’ve said above. Pretty much there is to stories like those that can’t be solved with just thinking about them. Whats more likely, humans can go out of there physical bodys or you simply dream it.

A famous Scientist once said “Extraordinary claims require extraordinary evidence” i’ve failed to see one piece of evidence here.

Oh and no Sanga this post isn’t directed at you, really I think this discussion should just end, we’ve already established that this “Astral Projection” is not some supernatural thing and is just a ridiculous claim made by idiots who can’t establish the difference between dream(in this case) and reality.

If anyone here is to even attempt to prove that this is true then at least have a basic study of how the brain and dreams work.[/quote]
our discussion did end :S anyway what i was going to say was: there is a theory(or it might be a fact i cant really remember) that you are always dreaming but when you return to consciousness your brain just lets go of the dreams and you forget them.

Read full topic

That’s called a dream…
If you’re talking about that, that has nothing to do with the supernatural, it’s like when you wake up from a nightmare your body is exhausted and you’re puffing and panting. It’s because the nightmare seems real to you so your body reacts to it like it would in reality.

I barely dream now and I haven’t had a nightmare since I was about 12. Maybe it’s to do with the fact that i’m skeptical about everything or maybe it’s just cause I used to have sleeping problems, I duno.

I used to have this, usually when i’m waking up in the morning but there’s nothing to it, it’s simply dreaming. Believing that it actually happened is retarded. It’s most likely your foot smashed against the wall in your dream because your leg pained not the other way round. If it was the other way round then it’s because of what i’ve said above. Pretty much there is to stories like those that can’t be solved with just thinking about them. Whats more likely, humans can go out of there physical bodys or you simply dream it.

A famous Scientist once said “Extraordinary claims require extraordinary evidence” i’ve failed to see one piece of evidence here.

Oh and no Sanga this post isn’t directed at you, really I think this discussion should just end, we’ve already established that this “Astral Projection” is not some supernatural thing and is just a ridiculous claim made by idiots who can’t establish the difference between dream(in this case) and reality.

If anyone here is to even attempt to prove that this is true then at least have a basic study of how the brain and dreams work.

item.title: Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Yah yah everyone has weird dreams, no one wants to hear them.

R.I.P RSC:

I’ve never experienced sleep paralysis, but I often lie on top of my arms. Usually when I wake up my hand feels a little odd, but about a week ago I woke up lying on the top of my arm, close to my shoulder. So my whole arm didn’t respond, it felt like some dead limb was hanging on my body. It freaked me out, and I had a bad day.

This is common. I don’t know how but I managed to get it in my leg last night. I went to take a piss and holy shit lol. Couldn’t use my leg.

Read full topic

item.title: Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

I used to have weird dreams, it happened for about a week night after night, I would be doing something (in dreams) then I couldn’t move and I would drown some how! always, either the car I was in flipped and I ound’t get out because I couldn’t move… It scared me shitless!

Read full topic

item.title: Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I used to have a dream in which I had to move around these fucking midgets. Night after night they whined that they wanted to go somewhere else. And it felt quite realistic.

I’ve never experienced sleep paralysis, but I often lie on top of my arms. Usually when I wake up my hand feels a little odd, but about a week ago I woke up lying on the top of my arm, close to my shoulder. So my whole arm didn’t respond, it felt like some dead limb was hanging on my body. It freaked me out, and I had a bad day.

Read full topic

item.title: Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:44, topic:280885”][quote author=goatee link=topic=370953.msg2805655#msg2805655 date=1243712674]

I used to kind of do this when I was little when I couldn’t get to sleep.
[/quote]Sleep Paralysis?

I used to get that when i was like 6. Sucked dick.

It’s great. I try induce it like every early morning.

From sleep paralysis, you directly enter a lucid dream.[/quote]

It’s not great actually, lieing in your bed for 10 minutes in the morning, only being able to move your eyes and panicking like shit because you can’t move, then screaming so loudly only to find, when you eventually gain control of your body, that you weren’t screaming at all and no one heard you. They were the worst days of my life right there, fucked me right up.

dragonfire455:

Same here, I used to experience the “little old lady” hallucination. Scared me shitless.

I used to have hallicunation of hundreds of faces laughing at me… then one night i woke up and hallucinated my mum coming into my room and giving me a giant time-out bar. I wasn’t even physically sick at the time. Times I’d rather forget lol.

Read full topic
